data.title: RoboGeisha (2009)
data.meta_description: Sisters Yoshie and Kikue are two Geisha who are abducted by a mysterious organization to be transformed into murderous cyborg assassins.
data.text:
I was just starting to figure out that these zany Sushi Typhoon designer imposter nu-Japanese genre films were consistently disappointing when RoboGeisha came out. Something about IT looked more fun or perhaps stylish than it's brothers and sisters. Still, I forget the chronology of my experience with these comedies but I was very pessimistic, so I waited. There has been an internal battle for an entire decade. It had to end.

And it is a better than it's brothers and sisters by my measure. It's pretty, dainty at times, neon at others. There were some genuine laughs in there but I think the tone of this humor is just a little too shrill for me. I totally support the novelty…

Robo Geisha is exactly what it sounds like. A film about robot geisha's but it's so much more than that. I'm not sure if it was my subtitles (or maybe just the translation to English) or if it was intentional but most of the dialogue is the funniest I've ever heard (well..read)

The opening scene is a beautiful geisha doing her thing...and then splitting open to release other robots to attack an established customer.

This is the story of Yoshie. Yoshie's older sister is a beautiful young geisha and Yoshie is told she's ugly and is forced to do the chores. One day they're invited to Mr. Kageno's home and it's revealed that they train geisha's to become the ultimate…
